title: Hardware Aware Ensemble Selection for Balancing Predictive Accuracy and Cost
abstract: arXiv:2408.02280v1 Announce Type: cross  Abstract: Automated Machine Learning (AutoML) significantly simplifies the deployment of machine learning models by automating tasks from data preprocessing to model selection to ensembling. AutoML systems for tabular data often employ post hoc ensembling, where multiple models are combined to improve predictive accuracy. This typically results in longer inference times, a major limitation in practical deployments. Addressing this, we introduce a hardware-aware ensemble selection approach that integrates inference time into post hoc ensembling. By leveraging an existing framework for ensemble selection with quality diversity optimization, our method evaluates ensemble candidates for their predictive accuracy and hardware efficiency. This dual focus allows for a balanced consideration of accuracy and operational efficiency. Thus, our approach enables practitioners to choose from a Pareto front of accurate and efficient ensembles.
